application_type_full: Full planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Erection of a two storey extension to provide one self contained house
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (A-1000 Rev A, A-1010 Rev A, A-1015 Rev A, A-1020 Rev A,  A-1100 Rev A, A-1200 Rev A, A-1210 Rev A,  A-1300 Rev A, Design Statement received 21 July 2021; Regulations Compliance Report received 17 August 2021; Fire Safety Compliance Statement, A-1400 Rev A received 24 September 2021; Energy Statement, Carbon Reporting received 28 October 2021; A-1230 Rev A received 15 December 2021; A-9002 Rev A received 22 December 2021; Recycling and Waste Management Strategy received 31 January 2022) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - The approved refuse and recycling store as shown on approved plan no. A-1230 Rev A shall be completed and made available for use before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, and thereafter shall be retained for such use at all times without obstruction. Bins shall be stored and managed in accordance with the Recycling and Waste Management Strategy received 31 January 2022.

Condition : 7 - (a) The development hereby permitted shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy.
(b) Prior to first occupation of any dwelling within the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure/National Calculation Method) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions, and achieved a 62 percent reduction in emissions.
(c) Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, suitable devices for the monitoring of the low and zero carbon technologies shall have been installed, and the monitored data shall be submitted automatically to a monitoring web-platform at daily intervals for a period of three years from the point of full operation.

Condition : 8 - Prior to first occupation of the development the applicant shall have entered into a formal agreement with the Council to provide a payment of ?1254 towards its Carbon Offset Fund, as outlined in the hereby approved Energy Statement.

Condition : 9 - The hereby approved development shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs of materials in-situ and/or copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the followings sustainable materials standards:
i. At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
ii. At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
iii. No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone

Condition : 10 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) hereby approved, evidence (schedule of installed fittings and manufactures literature) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105L/person/day or less.

Condition : 11 - Prior to the occupation of the hereby approved dwelling cycle parking details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority showing at least two cycle parking spaces in a secure and covered location and shall conform with the West London Cycle Parking Guidance. The cycle store shall be provided prior to the occupation of the development and retained as such for the duration of the development without obstruction.

Condition : 12 - The house hereby approved shall be used solely as a single family house (Use Class C3) and shall not be used for business purposes and or as a house in multiple occupation, including any use within Class C4 of The Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) or such other legislation as may subsequently supersede it.
